data.title: Literature under Israeli Occupation
data.meta_description: This period saw the entirety of Palestine fall under Israeli occupation and control. The brutal and violent Israeli military occupation was transferred to the newly occupied areas of Jerusalem, the West Bank, and Gaza. This gave rise to two literary geographies within Palestine, and two local literatures that struggled to connect to each other and to Palestinian literature in the diaspora.
data.meta_site_name: Country of Words: A Transnational Atlas for Palestinian Literature
